required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Prineo (Dermabond Protape) Versus Sutures in Breast Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-centre Study to Show Equivalence of Prineo (DERMABOND PROTAPE) to Intradermal Sutures for Skin Closure of Full-thickness Surgical Incisions Associated With Breast Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, controlled, randomized, multi-center clinical study of up to 80 patients with full thickness surgical incisions associated with bi-lateral breast procedures. Breast procedures where symmetrical incisions of at least 15cm in length are planned for both breast (bilateral procedure) will be randomised to receive final skin closure of one breast with Prineo (DERMABOND PROTAPE) and the other with intradermal sutures (control). Patients will be evaluated post-operatively at 24 hours (± 6 hours), 7 days (± 1 day), 12 - 25 days, and 90 days (± 10 days).

primary_outcome.measure: Continuous Apposition of the Skin Edges Without Wound Dehiscence or Re-closure as Measured by the Upper Limit of 95% Confidence Interval in Proportion of Successes for Each Groups.
primary_outcome.description: Equivalence was demonstrated if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval (when subtracting the percentage of DERMABOND PROTAPE successful subjects from the percentage of INTRADERMAL SUTURE successful subjects) did not exceed 12 percent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time (Minutes) Required to Close the Final Skin Layer
secondary_outcome.description: Overall time required to close final skin layer on each breast.

Modified Hollander Cosmesis Scale overall outcome score in which a score of 0 corresponds to a good outcome versus a 1-6 to a poor outcome. The proportions of breasts with good outcomes were then compared to those with poor outcomes in each group. Reference: Hollander JE, Singer AJ, Valentine S, Thode HC Jr, Henry MC. Wound registry:development and validation. Ann Emerg Med. 1995;25:675-85.

Modified Hollander Cosmesis Scale overall outcome score in which a score of 0 corresponds to a good outcome versus a 1-6 to a poor outcome. The proportions of breasts with good outcomes were then compared to those with poor outcomes in each group. Reference: Hollander JE, Singer AJ, Valentine S, Thode HC Jr, Henry MC. Wound registry:development and validation. Ann Emerg Med. 1995;25:675-85.

Wound registry:development and validation. Ann Emerg Med. 1995;25:675-85.

arm_group.description: On same patient, one breast is randomized to control and one breast is randomized to experimental arm. Patient is own control.
On same patient, one breast is randomized to control and one breast is randomized to experimental arm. Patient is own control.

intervention.description: cyanoacrylate and pressure sensitive adhesive mesh - topical skin adhesive

intervention.other_name: Investigator selected the intradermal suture per standard local practice.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from the genreal popluation of those undergoing elective, bilateral breast surgery.

group.title: Prineo and Suture
group.description: On same patient, one breast is randomized to control (intradermal sutures) and one breast is randomized to experimental arm (DERMABOND PROTAPE). Patient is own control. Protape is supplied as a single use mesh device with sufficient adhesive to saturate mesh. Sutures were not supplied.

group.title: Prineo and Suture
group.description: On same patient, one breast is randomized to control (intradermal sutures) and one breast is randomized to experimental arm (DERMABOND PROTAPE). Patient is own control. Protape is supplied as a single use mesh device with sufficient adhesive to saturate mesh. Sutures were not supplied.

outcome.title: Continuous Apposition of the Skin Edges Without Wound Dehiscence or Re-closure as Measured by the Upper Limit of 95% Confidence Interval in Proportion of Successes for Each Groups.
outcome.description: Equivalence was demonstrated if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval (when subtracting the percentage of DERMABOND PROTAPE successful subjects from the percentage of INTRADERMAL SUTURE successful subjects) did not exceed 12 percent.
outcome.population: The primary analysis is based upon intent to treat population.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Equivalence is demonstrated if the upper limit of the 95% confidence interval (when subtracting the percentage of DERMABOND PROTAPE successful subjects from the percentage of INTRADERMAL SUTURE successful subjects) does not exceed 12%.
analysis.estimate_desc: The level of significance for statistical testing was 0.05 for this study.

outcome.title: Cosmetic Outcome
outcome.description: Modified Hollander Cosmesis Scale overall outcome score in which a score of 0 corresponds to a good outcome versus a 1-6 to a poor outcome. The proportions of breasts with good outcomes were then compared to those with poor outcomes in each group. Reference: Hollander JE, Singer AJ, Valentine S, Thode HC Jr, Henry MC. Wound registry:development and validation. Ann Emerg Med. 1995;25:675–85.
outcome.population: There were 60 participants who consented to and ultimately attended all follow-up visits for evaluation of cosmetic outcome.

event.description: Following treatment, patient experienced postoperative sepsis and was hospitalized. Patient required surgical reintervention and was treated with antibiotics. No action was taken with respect to the study.

Subject underwent planned bilateral brachioplasty for hanging skin. The event required hospitalisation for medical/surgical intervention. In the opinion of the Investigator, the event was classified as not related to sutures or Prineo.
Nausea was assessed as not related to device but to procedure.
Events assessed not related device but to procedure.
Itchiness at application site assessed as not related to device but to procedure.
Events assessed as not related to device but to procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Limitations of this study include the fact that the patient served as her own control. Additionally, as in many device studies, because of the obvious difference in the investigated and the control devices, blinding was limited.
